page.title: 08LETTERS TO SOUTHPORT VISITOR
page.content: Many people who live in Sefton,a district of Merseyside,are pleased with the suggestion by certain local political parties that we leave this county and return to Lancashire.Most people are not happy that rate payers money is being spent on things that Liverpool City Council want and not on the amenities Southport needs. Another topic is the wierd one of dogs off their leads in the Botanic Gardens in Southport.The problem is getting worse and lots of people are worried about it.A man who wrote to the editor said "On Sunday I took my daughter to the childrens playground in the Botanic Gardens-she slipped and fell in a load of dog dirt".He carries to say how he saw at least two signs saying "dogs must be kept on a lead" but saw five dogs without leads.
